title: How to Use Erceflora to Treat Diarrhea and Improve Gut Health

steps.title: Check the dosage for your age.
steps.content: Check the dosage for your age. In most cases, Erceflora is prescribed as a liquid medication that comes in vials. [2] X Research source However, there is a capsule formula available, as well. Follow these dosaging guidelines: Babies aged 0 to 3: 1 to 2 vials per day. Children aged 4 to 15: 1 to 2 vials per day or 1-2 capsules per day. Teens and adults aged 16 and up: 2 to 3 vials per day or 2 to 3 capsules per day.

steps.title: Shake liquid Erceflora to mix the spores into the suspension.
steps.content: Shake liquid Erceflora to mix the spores into the suspension. It’s normal for your Erceflora spores to settle in the liquid, making it look clumpy. To dissolve the spores, shake the bottle to thoroughly mix the solution. Some people worry that the clumpy appearance is a sign the Erceflora has gone bad, but that’s just how it looks when it settles. It’s still safe to use.

steps.title: Mix the Erceflora into a drink to improve the taste.
steps.content: Mix the Erceflora into a drink to improve the taste. You can drink Erceflora directly from the vial, but some people find the taste unpleasant. To improve the flavor, dilute it in water, milk, tea, or orange juice. [3] X Research source This is especially helpful if you’re giving it to your child. If you’re taking Erceflora Kiddie, it’s okay to drink it straight from the vial because it has a tastier flavor. Make sure to drink the entire glass so that you get the full dose of Erceflora. If you’re giving Erceflora to an infant or child, ask your pediatrician if you can mix it with their formula, juice, or a pediatric electrolyte supplement.

steps.title: Take Erceflora at regular intervals.
steps.content: Take Erceflora at regular intervals. Schedule your dosages at the same time every day. For teens and adults, you’ll likely take 1 vial every 3 to 4 hours. On the flip side, children and babies will only take 1 to 2 vials a day, so they'll only take it once or twice a day. [4] X Research source For instance, you might take it at breakfast, lunch, and dinner to keep track of your doses. For a baby or child, you might give them the Erceflora at breakfast and dinner.

steps.title: Store sealed Erceflora at room temperature in a dry location.
steps.content: Store sealed Erceflora at room temperature in a dry location. B. clausii is very heat resistant, so you don’t need to refrigerate it. [5] X Research source The sealed vials can last for up to 2 years as long as they aren’t exposed to temperatures over 30 °C (86 °F). Keep the vials in a cool location out of reach of children, such as a kitchen cabinet. Once you open a vial of Erceflora, you will need to use the entire dose right away. Freezing Erceflora can damage the ingredients, so store it at room temperature.

steps.title: Take your Erceflora as directed by your doctor.
steps.content: Take your Erceflora as directed by your doctor. Depending on why you are taking Erceflora, you may need to use it for anywhere from 10 days to 3 months. Your doctor will tell you how long you need to take it, so follow their recommendations. [6] X Research source For diarrhea, Erceflora treatment usually lasts for 5 to 7 days. [8] X Trustworthy Source US Food and Drug Administration U.S. government agency responsible for promoting public health Go to source

steps.title: Contact your doctor if you experience any side effects.
steps.content: Contact your doctor if you experience any side effects. Side effects from Erceflora are rare, but some people may be allergic or exceptionally sensitive to it. [9] X Research source Call your doctor if you experience symptoms such as a rash, hives, or swelling in your hands, feet, or face. Call your local emergency number or go to the emergency room immediately if you experience symptoms of an allergic reaction, such as swelling of your lips, tongue or throat, as well as difficulty breathing, talking, or swallowing.

steps.title: Let your doctor know if you have a weakened immune system.
steps.content: Let your doctor know if you have a weakened immune system. Erceflora is safe for most people. [10] X Research source However, your doctor may not recommend it if you have a weakened immune system, either because of illness or due to medications you are taking. [11] X Trustworthy Source Harvard Medical School Harvard Medical School's Educational Site for the Public Go to source Tell your doctor if you have any health concerns before taking Erceflora. Ask your doctor about ways to strengthen your immune system.

steps.title: Provide a list of any other medicines or supplements you are taking.
steps.content: Provide a list of any other medicines or supplements you are taking. Erceflora isn’t known to interact with any other supplements or medications. [12] X Research source However, it’s still a good idea to give your doctor a full list of any supplements, prescription drugs, or over-the-counter medications you are currently using. Giving your doctor full information about what medicines you’re taking can help them make better decisions about your care.

steps.title: Diarrhea
steps.content: Diarrhea B. clausii supplements can help balance the bacteria in your gut. Ask your doctor about Erceflora if you have chronic diarrhea, persistent diarrhea that lasts as long as 14 days, or diarrhea caused by an infection or medication, such as antibiotics. [14] X Trustworthy Source US Food and Drug Administration U.S. government agency responsible for promoting public health Go to source They’ll help you decide if Erceflora is a good option for you. Erceflora is a common treatment for babies who suffer from diarrhea. [15] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source Erceflora may also be helpful for treating or preventing diarrhea caused by antibiotics or H. pylori therapy. [16] X Research source

steps.title: Chemotherapy Treatment
steps.content: Chemotherapy Treatment When you’re undergoing chemotherapy, your treatments affect your gut health because the drugs also kill good bacteria. [17] X Research source Erceflora replaces that good bacteria, so it helps repair your gut biome. Your doctor can help you decide if Erceflora can help you feel better. [18] X Research source

steps.title: Respiratory Infections
steps.content: Respiratory Infections In addition to treating imbalances in gut bacteria, B. clausii can be useful for preventing recurring respiratory infections, especially in children. [19] X Research source If your child suffers from frequent respiratory infections, talk to your pediatrician about whether Erceflora might help. This treatment is especially helpful for children with respiratory allergies, who are prone to frequent infections.
